samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The R project was officially announced in 1993, and version 1.0.0 was released in 2000. Since then, R has been maintained by the R Core Team, which consists of statisticians and computer scientists from around the world.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The R project was officially announced in 1993, and version 1.0.0 was released in 2000. Since then, R has been maintained by the R Core Team, which consists of statisticians and computer scientists from around the world.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
